newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London up in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London up in quiet trade.

text.p: Japanese stocks trading in London recovered Tuesday's losses on Wednesday despite low activity.
London's Nikkei 50 index was up 7.67 points to 1453.65 by 1505 GMT, after the benchmark Japanese Nikkei 225 index finished up for the first time in six trading days, closing at 20,659.91.
Traders described the day as "very quiet" and one said there was a distinct lack of interest in Japanese stock. "Share prices have been going up and down in the same pattern," he said.
Traders said apart from electronics, most stocks were down. Some activity was reported in bank stocks, but one dealer said he hadn't moved a price all day.
